title: What Does The Winter Solstice Mean For Your Zodiac Sign?
text:
What Does The Winter Solstice Mean For Your Zodiac Sign?

It‚Äôs time to put on our warmest scarf because winter is finally here! December 21st marks the onset of a new season and the sun‚Äôs entrance into Capricorn. Yuletide, which is the shortest day of the year, brings more than feel good movies; it is considered a moment when we connect with those we care about and reminisce about the good old days. The dip in the outside temperature warms our hearts by bringing us closer together. Also, we get to put on our flannel pajamas and drink hot chocolate while romancing, reconciling, and reminiscing during the Winter Solstice. As the holidays and new year approach, we are reminded that we are all united and that it‚Äôs essential to help others, not just ourselves. Bring positivity to the world! Spread the love!

Read your horoscopes for your Sun and Rising signs for the most in-depth forecast.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Aries

As you enter the last days of 2025, a rare and exciting opportunity arises at work. Before impulsively taking on the gig or promotion, ensure that you have a clear emotional discourse and seek advice from others before making a decision. If you play your cards right, you may be able to set a contract on your terms, which will be more beneficial to you.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Taurus

Taking a cooking or art class (you should venture out of town for a retreat) might enrich your talents, allowing you to understand that you are gifted and have much to give. You‚Äôll be the top student, getting praise from the teacher and peers. The compliments are uplifting, urging you to take this topic seriously. In time, you‚Äôll be the one educating and inspiring others.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Gemini

Even though you might not realize it, you have the chance to manifest the life you want. You are not aware of your magic and strength until now, so enhancing and enchanting your soul and spirit is key. You‚Äôll be amazed at how much you can accomplish when you are intentional about your goals. Believe in yourself and all you do. You got this, Gemini!

DashDividers_1_500x100

Cancer

Consider taking a chance by expressing your heartfelt sentiments. Being open to those you care about will jump start a new beginning in the relationship. You‚Äôll be able to bounce ideas off each other and share your innermost thoughts. Yule ignites the onset of a beautiful partnership. The season seems bright knowing that you‚Äôll be able to power through with the support of your squad.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Leo

This is a moment in which you can thrive, both mentally and physically. If there are any patterns or habits that you would like to improve upon, now is your chance to do so. You can start by engaging in wellness rituals (like yoga, meditation, or a hike) that connect to your body, mind, and spirit. The endeavor relaxes your aura, making tiy more mindful.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Virgo

The solstice urges you to plan a party with friends and invite loved ones. The group effort will not only bring you closer together, but the process will also allow you to see that you have much in common, from the theme and decor to the food being served. It will be a blast having a reason to spend time with your besties.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Libra

Dorothy Gale wasn‚Äôt wrong when she said: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no place like home.‚Äù Remember that your dwelling provides safety and comfort, which is why you‚Äôre in the mood to get cozy and snuggle up in bed with movies. If you decide to be social, host a few of your closest family members for a low-key lunch to reflect on old memories and to discuss what‚Äôs coming ahead.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Scorpio

You possess many excellent qualities, and it‚Äôs time for you to showcase your true self. Stop holding back and controlling how people perceive you. To cultivate genuine relationships, you must be your authentic self at all times. Chances are that people will accept you and adore the person you are on the inside. Let them get an insider peek instead of hiding who you are.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Sagittarius

Your leadership skills are on fire! For the first time in a while, you‚Äôre taking charge and making moves at the office. No one will stand in the way of your ability to connect with colleagues and have them join forces as a team to crush the competition. The same applies to impending holiday bonuses. Your motto: ‚ÄúAll for one and one for all!‚Äù

DashDividers_1_500x100

Capricorn

The sun shines on you, Capricorn! You will relish in popularity and awesomeness, helping you invigorate your vigor and fierceness. In honor of your return from hibernation, try to design a day of pampering that centers around doing what makes you feel extraordinary. Special activities, such as going to a concert or getting a pedicure, can be uplifting and cathartic to your energy and vibes.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Aquarius

Only you can figure out what makes you happy and how you can advance in life. Trusting your intuition will guide you forward. The moment you let go of your rational way of processing situations, the easier it will be to get to the bottom of situations. Additionally, it will feel good to trust your instincts and listen to what your heart is telling you.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Pisces

We often take the community we live in for granted, which means your sensitive nature may wish to give back to the neighborhood by doing volunteer and humanitarian work. No matter what you choose to partake in, the objective is to pay it forward. Being part of something bigger than yourself allows you to see that you can change the world with kindness and compassion.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?

Mars In Capricorn 2025 Is Here

title: You Didn‚Äôt Have To Be In Bondi For It To Hurt
text:
You Didn‚Äôt Have To Be In Bondi For It To Hurt

Content warning: This article discusses violence in a way that may be distressing to some readers. It was original published on Refinery29‚Äôs Australia edition.

On the first night of Hanukkah, beneath the quintessential glow of a Sydney summer evening, globally beloved and iconic Bondi Beach turned from a scene of joy to one of terror. Families and friends had gathered for a festive beachfront celebration, lighting the menorah and singing songs, when gunfire shattered the laughter. Two gunmen, a father and son armed with rifles, opened fire on the crowd, killing at least 15 people (including a child) and injuring dozens more. One attacker was shot dead by police, and the other was wounded and arrested amid the chaos. Australian authorities swiftly declared it a terrorist attack motivated by antisemitic hatred, an assault on the Jewish community that Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has said ‚Äústruck at the heart of the nation‚Äù. What should have been a night of light and hope became Australia‚Äôs worst mass shooting in nearly 30 years.

The next morning, Bondi‚Äôs sands lay empty and silent, an unheard-of phenomenon for one of the most popular shorelines in the country, save for investigators pacing the cordoned-off area. Since then, the stories and the heroism of bystanders who tried to stop the shooters have dominated headlines. Yet the impact of this attack cannot be measured only in lives lost or injuries. Its shockwaves have rippled far beyond those who stood on the sand that night; the tragedy has seared itself into the psyche of people around the world, including many who were nowhere near Bondi Beach when it happened.

Beyond The Shore

Not even in the hours after the attack, but during, phones pinged with news alerts across Australia and overseas. Many who read the headlines or watched grainy and graphic videos felt a chill of grief and fear. It didn‚Äôt matter that they were seeing it through a screen; their hearts broke, and their fear was felt in real time. In Sydney, thousands gathered at vigils the next day, mourners at Bondi laid flowers and sang prayers under the open sky. Similar tributes appeared in other cities, in Melbourne, in London outside the Australian High Commission, and beyond ‚Äî a sign that the world was mourning with Bondi.

‚ÄúCollective trauma can impact how we view the world and how we see ourselves in it ‚Äî the social norms and security we were used to are challenged, making us feel unsafe and unsure, and grieving the world we understood,‚Äù explains Mental Health Therapist Tammi Miller.

According to Principal Psychologist at Umeed Psychology, Anushka Phal, this reaction is a form of collective trauma or vicarious trauma. ‚ÄúHumans don‚Äôt exist in isolation; we‚Äôre part of communities,‚Äù Phal describes this as identity-based trauma: ‚ÄúFor people with histories of trauma, chronic stress, racism, gender-based violence, or migration stress, the nervous system is already primed to ask: Am I safe? Am I next? The body doesn‚Äôt treat it as ‚Äònews‚Äô ‚Äî it treats it as confirmation.‚Äù She adds: ‚ÄúEven secondhand exposure can activate the threat system ‚Äî particularly in a 24/7 media environment. The nervous system doesn‚Äôt respond to logic; it responds to danger cues, which can show up as hypervigilance, irritability, flatness, grief, and even physical symptoms.‚Äù

Decades of research on vicarious traumatization show that people can develop stress symptoms from simply hearing about or seeing footage of violent events. Our brains, in a sense, replay the horror as if we were there. One study even found that individuals with no prior trauma who watched distressing news reports showed symptoms of secondary traumatic stress, such as anxiety, nightmares, and feelings of helplessness. In the case of the Bondi attack, it brutally resonated far and wide ‚Äì from the Jewish community in Sydney to anyone who has ever set foot on Bondi.

As Rachel Tomlinson, a Sydney-based therapist (and one of many professionals volunteering at community support sessions this week), points out: ‚ÄúTrauma is processed through the nervous system first, not the thinking brain. That‚Äôs why people feel sick, shaky, or disconnected ‚Äî the body is responding to a perceived threat even before we can name the emotion.‚Äù

She continues, ‚ÄúEven indirect exposure ‚Äî like media ‚Äî can activate this system. Freeze or dissociation responses are just as real as panic. You might feel emotionally flat, stuck, or spaced out. It‚Äôs a survival response, not weakness.‚Äù

Coping With The Invisible Wounds

1. Mental health experts emphasize that your feelings are valid. Even if you were not physically present. There‚Äôs no need to say, ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt there, so I shouldn‚Äôt be this upset.‚Äù Grief, anger, fear, outrage, and numbness, all of these are natural responses. ‚ÄúGive yourself permission to feel whatever comes,‚Äù advises Anushka Phal. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt bottle it up just because you weren‚Äôt at the scene. You‚Äôre human, and at our core, humans care about each other.‚Äù Acknowledging the pain is a first step to healing. That might mean talking to friends or family about how the news affected you, or writing down your thoughts in a journal. Some find comfort in attending vigils or religious services to honor the victims, as coming together in solidarity can ease the sense of powerlessness. Others might light a candle at home or say a prayer as a personal act of remembrance.

2. Limiting media exposure is another important coping strategy. While it‚Äôs natural to seek information after a traumatic event, endlessly scrolling through graphic images or videos can retraumatize you. ‚ÄúBeing unable to control when or what imagery you see following an event like the Bondi attack can make it difficult to self-regulate,‚Äù says Miller. ‚ÄúRepeated exposure can trigger a stress response ‚Äî difficulty sleeping, irritability, trouble concentrating. It‚Äôs important to remember that you are safe in these moments, to look around you and name three things you can see, touch, feel, practise deep breathing and centering, and definitely to seek support from a confidant or trained mental health professional.‚Äù

3. Connecting with others is crucial in these times. The Bondi Beach community has exemplified this ‚Äì within 24 hours, thousands of people gathered to comfort one another, sing together, and remind themselves that they are not alone. Whether you attend a local vigil or simply call a friend to talk, sharing your feelings can lighten the emotional load. Sometimes just hearing someone say ‚ÄúI feel it too‚Äù can be profoundly validating. If your distress persists or feels overwhelming, consider reaching out to a mental health professional. Therapists are aware that indirect trauma is real and can help you work through it. There is no shame in seeking help; it doesn‚Äôt matter that ‚Äúit didn‚Äôt happen to me,‚Äù what matters is that it affected you, and getting support is a sign of strength, not weakness.

4. Finally, it can be healing to channel your emotions into positive action. Donate to a victims fund. Support crisis lines like Lifeline, which are seeing a huge surge in calls and will continue to through the holidays. Volunteer your time if you have capacity ‚Äî or if you don‚Äôt, drop off a meal, check in on a friend, walk someone home. Acts of care don‚Äôt need to be big to matter. They just need to happen.

Finding Light After The Darkness

In the days since the attack, the golden sands of Bondi have been blanketed with flowers, candles, and handwritten messages. Strangers hug each other on the promenade, united in grief. The air carries the mingled scents of saltwater and candle wax as the sun sets each evening over a beach that is healing from trauma seen and unseen. The emotional wounds from that night will take time to mend, and some scars may never fully fade. But amid the sorrow, there is a steadfast resolve that the forces of hatred will not break the spirit of the community.

For anyone struggling with heavy emotions after this tragedy, know that you are entitled to those feelings, they speak to your empathy, and that with time and support, the fear and anguish can evolve into strength and meaning.

Further Support

Mental Health Support (NSW):
‚Äì Walk-in help available daily at Intercontinental Coogee (8am ‚Äì 8pm).
‚Äì Safe Haven at Sydney Children‚Äôs Hospital for young people (10am ‚Äì 7:30pm).
‚Äì NSW clinicians are also on the ground at Bondi and Coogee; look for bright vests.

Helplines:
‚Äì Lifeline: 13 11 14
‚Äì NSW Mental Health Line: 1800 011 511
‚Äì Beyond Blue: 1300 22 4636
‚Äì Kids Helpline: 1800 55 1800

Find A Psychologist:
‚Äì Tala Thrive: A directory that helps you find culturally responsive and trauma-informed therapists across Australia.
‚Äì Australian Psychological Society: The largest peak professional body for psychologists and psychology in Australia.¬†
‚Äì Check with your GP: Many psychologists can only be accessed with a mental health care plan referral, which allows you to claim Medicare rebates.
‚Äì University Clinics: If cost is a barrier, psychology clinics at universities often offer low-fee sessions with provisional psychologists under supervision.

Managing Mental Health Between Therapist Visits

title: 15 Cute Nail Art Ideas For All Kinds Of New Year‚Äôs Eve Plans
text:
15 Cute Nail Art Ideas For All Kinds Of New Year‚Äôs Eve Plans

We might still be in the midst of work parties, gift shopping, and finalizing our festive manicures, but once Christmas Day has come and gone, there‚Äôs another occasion to get ready for: New Year‚Äôs Eve.

Whether you prefer to dress head-to-toe in sequins and party until the early hours or you‚Äôre more likely to be found curled up on the sofa in your comfies, there‚Äôs quite a lot of pressure that comes with planning the evening. Regardless of how we end up spending it, though, we‚Äôll never turn down a fresh set of nails to mark the occasion.

This year, so many incredible nail artists have served up New Year‚Äôs Eve nail inspiration that will suit whatever you have on the agenda. From minimalist pearlescent tips to glitter-adorned embellishments, take a scroll through 12 of our favorite looks to help you see in 2025 in style.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Celestial Velvet Tips

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Stacey Machin Nail Artist (@staceymachin)

Nail artist Stacey Machin perfectly captures the nuance of a velvet party dress and sparkly accessories with her green cat-eye French tips and chrome star details. Asking for thicker tips lets the cat-eye polish really dazzle in the light.

Chrome All Over

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Iram Shelton (@iramshelton)

Iram Shelton proves you can‚Äôt go wrong with all-over chrome nails. This molten silver hue is beautiful on dark skin tones.

Leopard Tips

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Jaz (@paintbyjaz)

Proving that even minimalists can enjoy a walk on the wild side, Jaz‚Äôs combination of red-trimmed, leopard-print tips and gold star detailing feels celebratory yet wearable. You can bet that nobody else will have nails like them.

Disco Dance Floor

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by MANCHESTER BIAB & NAIL ART SPECIALIST ü§ç ZOE GRIFFITHS (@griffsgelstudio)

Dreamed up by nail artist Zoe Griffiths, the silver flecks on a glossy grey base are reminiscent of a disco dance floor.

Crushed Foil

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by The Mani Club (@themaniclub)

Metallic nails are a classic choice for New Year‚Äôs Eve. The Mani Club‚Äôs take on the trend for this year combines a chic silver hue with crushed foil detailing for texture and shine. Try OPI Work From Chrome Nail Polish to recreate the look at home.

Chrome Details

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Julita ‚Äì Russian Manicurist, Content Creator & Educator (@buffhernailsuk)

Ultra-polished and perfectly executed, Julita‚Äôs high-shine manicure is beautifully minimal with the chicest chrome tips and swirls for subtle detail. Nails.Inc‚Äôs Glowing Somewhere Nail Illuminator will give you a similar pearly shine without the need for gels.

Celestial Gems

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Bryony Howell (@gelsbybry)

A celebration in manicure form, we can‚Äôt get enough of Bryony‚Äòs sparkling gemstone-topped stars. Add Ulta Beauty Collection You‚Äôre a Gem Nail Gems Set to a basic manicure for some glitz.

French Pearl

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Iram Shelton (@iramshelton)

This might look like your classic French manicure, but Iram Shelton has given a timeless look a party makeover by using a pearlescent base color complete with subtle pearl embellishments. So chic.

Glitter Saturation

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Amy Le (@amyle.nails)

If there‚Äôs ever an occasion to take a maximalist approach to sparkle, then it‚Äôs New Year‚Äôs Eve. When all-out glitter looks as good as it does on Amy Le‚Äôs eye-catching manicure, then we don‚Äôt need much more convincing. Essie‚Äôs Luxe Nail Polish in A Cut Above is brimming with glitter.

Deconstructed Disco Ball

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Melanie Graves (@overglowedit)

Melanie Grave‚Äôs silver manicure takes all the elements of a disco ball ‚Äî sparkle, shine, and texture ‚Äî and breaks it down into this fun, mix-and-match nail look. Experiment with Nails.Inc Silver Served Mirror Chrome Nail Polish for your own take on these nails at home.

Gold 3D Tips

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by (GEL X and BIAB) (@katxnails)

Switching up the color of your French tips is a great option for a simple party look. Nail artist Kat takes it one step further by pairing these molten chrome gold tips with an abstract 3D texture.

Green Gleam

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Mateja Novakovic (@matejanova)

We couldn‚Äôt wave goodbye to 2025 without a nod to the film of the festive season, Wicked. This movie has had a major influence on autumn/winter nail trends, and green jewel tones are a perfect party look, as shown by Mateja Novakovic‚Äôs simple yet striking manicure. OPI‚Äôs Nail Lacquer in Ozitively Elphaba is the exact shade used here.

Velvet Nails

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Aistƒó Haas (@heygreatnails)

Glass nails and cat-eye textures have been huge this year, and Aistƒó Haas‚Äô interpretation of the trend feels special enough for New Year‚Äôs Eve. The deep color palette means the finish doesn‚Äôt feel too OTT, but you could mix-and-match the shades depending on which outfit you‚Äôre wearing.

Bejeweled French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Samantha üåπ (@samrosenails)

Gold glitter and multicolored gemstones sound like the makings of a pretty dramatic nail look. Samantha‚Äôs choice to concentrate all that color and texture on the tips means this New Year‚Äôs Eve manicure feels fun yet wearable.

title: Luxury Travel Gifts For The Jet-Setter Who‚Äôs Always Booking Flights
text:
Luxury Travel Gifts For The Jet-Setter Who‚Äôs Always Booking Flights This holiday season, we‚Äôve found the gifts that feel great to get and even better to give. Shop our collection of editor-approved holiday gift guides¬†here.

If there‚Äôs someone on your shopping list who lives for their next vacation (and maybe takes the saying "catch flights, not feelings" a bit too literally), you can‚Äôt go wrong with giving them a travel gift this holiday season. The challenge lies in sourcing the right present to support their passion ‚Äî after all, they‚Äôve probably seen everything on their adventures, and will have an equally discerning eye for weekender bags and airport outfits.

But, fret not, this is where our tingling shopping senses come in: We‚Äôve searched high and low for the luxury travel gifts and packing must-haves that‚Äôll make your giftee's next journey the five-star experience they deserve. No matter their preferred travel method or most frequent travel plans ‚Äî from vacations to work trips ‚Äî we‚Äôve compiled a range of practical, luxurious, and thoughtful presents. Think everything from versatile carry-on bags, cozy neck pillows, and stylish earplugs for long-haul flights; hard-shell cases, travel-size skincare, and roomy toiletry bags for train journeys; along with chic travel journals, compressive packing cubes, and compact reusable bottles for road trips.

And while this list contains some of the most luxe gifts, many of the travel accessories included can be found on Amazon or cost under $50, proving that high quality doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean expensive or unattainable. Just order them ASAP so they arrive on time!

All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker Uses Google‚Äôs Try-On Feature ‚Äî So I Had To Try It
text:
Sarah Jessica Parker Uses Google‚Äôs Try-On Feature ‚Äî So I Had To Try It

While we all may have very clear visions of Carrie Bradshaw running around Manhattan in Manolo Blahnik heels and spending hours playing dress up in luxury stores, the real life style icon Sarah Jessica Parker, today, is opting for quick and efficient online shopping with the help of Google.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt consider myself a very good shopper because I‚Äôm seduced by imagery and what looks great on somebody else. But there‚Äôs a truth about my size and what colors look good on me,‚Äù Parker exclusively tells Refinery29. And thanks to Google‚Äôs ‚ÄúTry On‚Äù feature, Parker can actually envision herself in pieces before hastily carting them up. ‚ÄúI think this is one use of [AI] that feels not only benign, but potentially quite helpful. It creates clarity about how things may or may not look on you.‚Äù

While I‚Äôm personally quite weary of AI in general, as I was speaking to SJP, I knew I had to try this feature for myself. Because although I wax poetic about all the best fashion to shop online, I find myself gravitating more towards in-person shopping because I‚Äôm unsure how many pieces will fit my petite-yet-curvy body. With that, I used some of SJP‚Äôs best holiday season dressing advice to see how her favorite styles actually look on myself through Google Try On.

The technology came out earlier this year, but it‚Äôs just gotten a refresh with SJP‚Äôs new holiday campaign. According to Google‚Äôs blog, the virtual try-on technology allows ‚Äúshoppers to try on billions of items of clothing from our Shopping Graph. It‚Äôs powered by a new custom image generation model for fashion, which understands the human body and nuances of clothing ‚Äî like how different materials fold, stretch and drape on different bodies.‚Äù

Again, I was skeptical but excited at the same time.

Self-declared ‚Äúlousy shopper‚Äù Parker explains: ‚ÄúI just think it‚Äôs really helpful and really user-friendly, and I‚Äôm hoping it kind of cuts out some of the chaos and hysteria around shopping,‚Äù adding: ‚ÄúI think this idea of Google Shopping with the ability to actually see it on your person takes some of that intimidation away, but also you feel more assured that you‚Äôre purchasing something that will likely really suit the occasion and your person.‚Äù

It works by searching for fashion items on Google and clicking into a product suggestion before seeing a ‚Äútry it on‚Äù pop-up button. Then you can upload a full-body image of yourself and the AI technology realistically adds the clothing onto your body. It also has a follow-up feature where you can save and send the image to your group chat if you need a second opinion. (And if you‚Äôre wondering, SJP says she would definitely text looks to longtime collaborator and Sex and the City costume designer Molly Rogers for fashion help).

As SJP went on listing her favorite festive attire ‚Äî from houndstooth and platinum to ‚Äúchiffon big skirts from the eighties with a leotard‚Äù (√† la Carrie Bradshaw) and jewel-tone tights paired with patent leather Mary Janes ‚Äî I put some to the test with Google Try On.

After uploading a couple of full-body photos of myself wearing fitting clothing as suggested on my phone, one photo worked best and saved into Google so it could be reused for every new product I selected. (I think in the future I‚Äôd opt for a tank top and biker shorts for the most accurate depiction of my body, especially for skin-baring pieces, but I was pleased with how Google auto-generated my body, especially in mini dresses (see below).

‚ÄúI went to a party the other evening and the host was wearing a pinstripe suit, but the pinstripes were all sparkly, and I loved it,‚Äù Parker says. And so I searched for just that and clicked on a suit from Sandro via Nordstrom, which I could see myself standing in within 10 seconds. (It‚Äôs important to note that the feature doesn‚Äôt work on the first sponsored products that pop up on the search page, and not every single retailer offers it.)

I also wanted to virtually try on a vintage-inspired party dress after Parker declared: ‚ÄúI personally love plaids and tartans this time of year. It‚Äôs really old fashioned, but I see more and more of it and it‚Äôs really exciting.‚Äù Eager to try a Free People dress with a drop waist and bubble skirt (both trendy yet polarizing silhouettes), I was pleasantly surprised by how it looked on my body.¬†The feature even styled me in the same shoes that the model is wearing.

And when she isn‚Äôt attending lavish soirees, SJP is opting for humble winter wardrobe staples. ‚ÄúMy day-to-day, I‚Äôm in waffle-cotton Hanes men‚Äô s leggings in white. And I‚Äôm in 20-year-old cashmere cardigans from J. Crew.‚Äù

I‚Äôll spare you the unflattering image of me wearing Hanes‚Äô men‚Äôs leggings. But hey, thankfully I could try them virtually before assuming just because SJP loves them that they‚Äôd also look good on me, and wasting my time and money! But it was fun playing around with how more practical cardigans ‚Äî as well as more elaborate styles, like gowns that I may never actually wear ‚Äî looked like.¬†

‚ÄúI just think people can have things on their body that they might never have had a chance to try,‚Äù Parker explains, adding: ‚ÄúIt feels like it‚Äôs a nice way for people to have some more assurance and also a touch of fantasy.‚Äù

So, if you‚Äôre needing some festive outfit inspo and fantasy (from the comfort of your couch), consider it sorted.

What To Get Yourself This Holiday Season

title: Andra Day Says Bradley Cooper ‚ÄúBacked Up His Support‚Äù By Casting Her As His Wife In Is This Thing On?
text:
Andra Day Says Bradley Cooper ‚ÄúBacked Up His Support‚Äù By Casting Her As His Wife In Is This Thing On?

Is This Thing On? may not seem like a movie where you‚Äôd find Grammy-award winner and Oscar nominee Andra Day. It‚Äôs about a white man doing stand-up comedy after all. But the Bradley Cooper-directed divorce dramedy starring Will Arnett and Laura Dern wouldn‚Äôt be complete without Day, who brings some brutal honesty and a delightful groundedness to the film. She plays Christine, the best friend to Dern‚Äôs Tess, and the wife of Cooper‚Äôs Balls (yes, that‚Äôs really his character‚Äôs name). Tess is going through a divorce with Arnett‚Äôs Alex, who turns to stand-up comedy to cope with their breakup. Day is so good as Christine in every scene, it feels like you‚Äôre eavesdropping on old friends who can‚Äôt help but tell each other the truth ‚Äî no matter how uncomfortable.¬†

Cooper handpicked Day for the role and was sure she‚Äôd say no. ‚ÄúI was just crossing my fingers with Andra,‚Äù Cooper says in the film‚Äôs production notes. ‚ÄúI just knew she would say no, but I had to offer it to her. When I saw The United States vs. Billie Holliday, I was floored. I was like, ‚ÄòLook, I apologize that the real estate is going to be small here, but here is the terrain. Would you please come do this with me?‚Äô It was a huge coup to get her.‚Äù And with the small real estate Day is given, she builds a brick house. It‚Äôs a no-bullshit performance that leaps off the screen, leaving the audience wanting more of Christine. And the dynamic between her and Tess ‚Äúmakes for a delicious, spiky friendship,‚Äù Dern says.¬†

Here, Day talks about Cooper‚Äôs support, building rapport with Dern, singing with Sean Hayes, and why she‚Äôd never get back together with an ex.

Refinery29 Unbothered: I loved the film and was surprised by how much I was moved by it! I know that Bradley Cooper said he had to convince you, or that when he asked you to do this, he didn‚Äôt think you would say yes.¬†

Andra Day: Is this what he‚Äôs telling people? [laughs] He did not have to convince me of anything! He just popped on the screen and he was Bradley Cooper and I was like, ‚Äúgreat idea, let‚Äôs work together!‚Äù He‚Äôs so funny. I genuinely was very excited to be a part of [this movie]. I‚Äôm a huge fan of his work as an actor. I‚Äôm a huge fan of his work as a director. I just think he‚Äôs just shown he‚Äôs just such a brilliant director. He‚Äôs just a great filmmaker. So I was excited. I was like, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm actually looking forward to being in your hands and seeing what you put together with this cast.‚Äù I‚Äôm so glad you love the movie. And maybe I‚Äôm biased, but I love the movie too.

Tell me more about why you chose to take on this role.

AD: I was really moved by [Bradley Cooper‚Äôs] support. I also knew that he was really supportive of two other movies I had done. So for him to back up that support with the offer to play this character, I thought was really, really special. And then he starts describing the movie to me. It‚Äôs Will Arnett‚Äôs baby, and they‚Äôve been friends for such a long time. So I love that it was he [cast] himself as [the character] Balls, because who else better to play Will‚Äôs best friend than his actual best friend? I love the dynamic of the friend group. I love the themes of truth, of rediscovery, of transformation, and communication, and just growth. I think it‚Äôs so funny. We always talk about growth, but we never allow each other to change. So I love that the movie dealt with all of those themes. And then Bradley mentioned the names Will Arnett, Laura Dern and Sean Hayes. And I was like, this is all just getting too crazy. They are all just so great. It was a dream cast to work with and it was exactly what I thought it would be. And better.

I love what you just said: ‚Äúwe always talk about growth, but we don‚Äôt allow each other to change.‚Äù That was a bar!¬†

AD: You know, maybe I was a little rapper in my past life [laughs]. Nah, I‚Äôm just kidding but I think it‚Äôs true!¬†

I want to talk about that cast that you mentioned, because there are some heavy hitters. You play Laura Dern‚Äôs best friend, Christine. Talk about building that rapport with Laura Dern, because it does feel like you‚Äôre just dropped into this years-long friendship. How did you build that rapport?

AD: It‚Äôs amazing to feel like you were just dropped in this relationship. I think that‚Äôs a testament to the great writing, the great direction and how it was shot, but also the truth.¬† Bradley absolutely requires truth. That‚Äôs the thing we‚Äôre looking for. But working with Laura, first of all, I‚Äôm just such a huge fan of her work. Laura plays such an array of characters, and so, of course, you walk into her space and you‚Äôre intimidated at first. You got to make sure you show up and support and you‚Äôre present but beyond that, being able to work with Laura and discovering, oh, wow, she is amazing. She‚Äôs great at what she does, and a huge part of that is how generous she is on set, how generous she is with not just the director and her co stars, but everyone on set, every actor, personnel on set and and how honest and open she is about herself as a human, and how much of that she brings to the character.¬†

Christine is such a protective friend.

AD: I love that you see that! [laughs]¬†

She‚Äôs like, don‚Äôt mess with my girl! How protective of a friend are you? Could you relate to that in Christine?

AD: No, I have ADHD, so I can‚Äôt focus on shit. Most of the time I don‚Äôt even remember. [laughs] I‚Äôm just kidding! No,I think I am a protective friend. [gestures off camera]. Look, I have a friend in the room that‚Äôs nodding her head ‚Äúyes‚Äù and laughing right now.

I think I am definitely a protective friend, for sure. What I like about Christine, though, is that she is a protective friend, but she will also protect you from yourself. I think that what I love about her character is her brutal honesty. I think what makes it so not just digestible, but actually endearing, is the fact that she is equally as brutally honest with herself. That‚Äôs really the only way to be honest with someone, that‚Äôs the only way they can actually trust your advice or your critique, if that they know that you hold yourself to that same standard. I think we‚Äôre similar in that way. I can be very protective, and not just physically, but also emotionally when it comes to friends and people that I love.

Stand-up comedy is the beating heart throughout this film. Is stand-up something you‚Äôve ever thought about doing? Did this movie change your opinion of it at all?¬†

AD: Stand-up comedy is never something I ever thought about doing, and still have never thought about doing because it looks terrifying to me. You know what‚Äôs funny, I was saying¬† about the movie that it makes me laugh when we describe John Bishop [who inspired] Will Arnett‚Äôs character, Alex Novak, and they‚Äôre like, ‚ÄúYeah, he just kind of did this stand-up because he didn‚Äôt want to pay the cover.‚Äù And I‚Äôm like, ‚Äúguys, that‚Äôs not normal.‚Äù [laughs]. Like, if it were me, and someone was like, you can either pay the cover or you can go do stand up. I‚Äôm either coming out of my pocket 15 bucks or I‚Äôm going to the restaurant down the street. I‚Äôm not going to do a set of stand-up for $15!¬† It‚Äôs too terrifying.¬†

I think it takes something inherently in you to do that. But what I learned was about the community of stand-up. I think it‚Äôs an incredible community. Bradley [Cooper] has always loved stand-up. And I think we all have, right? The Richard Pryors, Eddie Murphys. But the connectedness and the camaraderie were amazing to me. It used to be a lot more competitive. Now, when you dip into the culture, you realize that they‚Äôre doing, like, 3 to 6, clubs a night, which is insane. The grind is such that I‚Äôve always admired stand-up comics, I loved to see how connected they are. And I think that Bradley [Cooper] and Will [Arnett] did an incredible job of showing this community, how they support each other, how they joke, and how honest they are as people.

There‚Äôs this incredible scene where you and Sean Hayes sing ‚ÄúAmazing Grace.‚Äù How did that come to be?

AD: First, I love singing with Sean. I love Sean‚Äôs voice. Twas an amazing scene to shoot. It was amazing because it wasn‚Äôt written in the script. The night before, I got a call from Bradley that was like, ‚ÄúWhat do you think about singing ‚ÄòAmazing Grace‚Äô?‚Äù I was like, ‚ÄúSure!‚Äù That was one of the later scenes we shot and I was, I was used to us being on set and being able to pivot. Who knows if it would be amazing or if it‚Äôd be really cringe and weird? I didn‚Äôt know. But it worked.

That scene, for me, and a lot of the Oyster Bay scenes, helped me to feel much more a part of this group. It just felt like we just were enjoying each other‚Äôs presence while we were on set filming that scene. And then I think it translated for the audience ‚Äî them singing Amazing Grace added like, 10 or 15 years to their friendship.¬†

We‚Äôre going to end on a little game. I‚Äôm going to give you scenarios ‚Äî based on the movie ‚Äî and the answers are either ‚ÄúBothered or Unbothered.‚Äù Your partner decides to become a stand up comedian later in life, bothered or unbothered?¬†

AD: Unbothered! I‚Äôm an artist in that way. I‚Äôm just kind of like, ‚Äúyou‚Äôre fine. Try it if you love it!‚Äù

You don‚Äôt like your best friend‚Äôs husband: bothered or unbothered?

AD: Super bothered! Super duper bothered!¬†

Telling your best friend‚Äôs man you used to have a crush on him.

AD: Oohh. This is where I differ from my character. I‚Äôm a little more bothered about that.

Getting back together with an ex.

AD: Bothered, bothered, bothered! You an ex for a reason.

Your friend doesn‚Äôt tell you she got back together with her ex. Bothered or unbothered?

AD: Bothered. Not because you got back with your ex ‚Äî unless he‚Äôs a toxic ex ‚Äî I‚Äôm like, sis, what are we doing? Bothered, because if he‚Äôs a decent person, then what am I doing that made you feel uncomfortable to talk to me about that? If we‚Äôre best friends and I‚Äôm a confidant, then I‚Äôm bothered a little bit with myself and the situation.

When people announce their breakup on social media or publicly.

AD: I don‚Äôt care. Unbothered. I‚Äôm like, do you! Who cares?

Finally, using your personal life as fodder for art or comedy, bothered or unbothered?

AD: Unbothered, that‚Äôs actually art and comedy. I‚Äôm bothered when you don‚Äôt use it at all. You know what I‚Äôm saying? That‚Äôs when I‚Äôm bothered.

Is This Thing On? is in theaters Friday, December 19.¬†

This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.

title: The Final New Moon Of 2025 Will Bring A Major Shake Up
text:
The Final New Moon Of 2025 Will Bring A Major Shake Up

In true form, the New Moon in Sagittarius on December 19th is going to be a wild roller coaster of emotions. It‚Äôs officially the last new moon of 2025 and it‚Äôs going to bring high energy and a truly uplifting lunar reset.

But just when we thought we had escaped confusing and ambiguous times brought on by a season of five planetary retrogrades, the New Moon in Sagittarius arrives and shakes up our emotions and relationships ‚Äî¬†once again. Venus in Sagittarius, Saturn in Pisces, and Neptune in Pisces aspect the New Moon, creating a mixed bag of emotions. Venus‚Äô alignment gives us hope to enhance our love lives, while Saturn limits and Neptune heightens our fantasies ‚Äî so, we may feel as though we are stuck in a situationship that‚Äôs holding us back, but have faith that things will get better soon. Add in a minor frustration from Jupiter retrograde in Cancer and Uranus retrograde in Taurus, and the vibe gets both saucy and sassy.¬†

As a result, our intuition will prove to be powerful. It‚Äôll be easier than ever for us to comprehend matters on a spiritual level. The flip side is that we might also be paranoid or delulu in certain matters. Finding a balance between embracing our instincts and logic is pivotal to ensure we don‚Äôt go overboard in one direction over another. It‚Äôll be challenging to remain centered, which is why grounding exercises such as connecting to the body through yoga or a walk in nature will do us good. This activity will clear our minds and remind us to remain present ‚Äî no matter what the universe throws our way.

The need for change is strong, as we yearn to evolve in our love lives. The lessons Saturn imparts on us are going to rock our worlds for the better. The fog brought on by Neptune might hold us captive, but it will dissipate soon. Trusting our hearts and others unthinkingly can lead us to question what we want and whether we are making the best choices, but we‚Äôll see that our innate divine wisdom and knowledge hold the key to our happiness. Ignoring outside noise and opinions of others helps guide us to the right space and place. Venus and the New Moon push us to roll the dice and bet on our feelings. We have to ‚Äúknow when to hold ‚Äòem and when to fold ‚Äòem.‚Äù

The following day, Mercury in Sagittarius squares the Nodes of Destiny on the Pisces and Virgo lunar axis. It‚Äôll be hard to find the best way to move forward without drama or arguments, since we are bewildered about what the best path is. The mutable T-Square is causing our nerves to heighten. Our anxieties might reach a fever pitch as we continue to ruminate over the avenue we wish to pursue. Before getting into a headspin and over matters, take a step back and contemplate through meditation. If we are lucky, the universe will grant us both clarity and self-discovery.

In moments like this, it‚Äôs always great to reflect and take stock of our desires and progress. The Temperance tarot card (which aligns with the sun sign Sagittarius) represents this sentiment, since it focuses on how we can find our calm in turbulent times. Patience ignites the dream to come alive. Therefore, we shouldn‚Äôt make impetuous decisions. Moderation is essential to finding our deepest feelings, motives, and passions. Even though we are caught in the middle of the storm, we can navigate it. The only way out is through ‚Äî we won‚Äôt realize it immediately, but we are in the driver‚Äôs seat. Let your senses and heart be the map that you listen to.

title: 27 Gifts For The Woman Who Has Everything & Wants Nothing
text:
27 Gifts For The Woman Who Has Everything & Wants Nothing This holiday season, we‚Äôve found the gifts that feel great to get and even better to give. Shop our collection of editor-approved holiday gift guides¬†here.

We all have those people in our lives ‚Äî the ones who say they don't want anything for the holidays ‚Äî whether they feel like they already have everything they could need, or simply don‚Äôt like the attention that comes with gift-receiving. But, come gift-giving season, those same people are inevitably handing you a meticulously wrapped, thoughtful present‚Ä¶ and you don't really want to be empty-handed in that moment. What, then, makes a good gift for the hard-to-please person?

Whether you want to go down the route of practical gifts that they‚Äôll definitely use on a daily basis or little luxuries that they‚Äôre totally deserving of, we curated a range of thoughtful gifts for your mom, best friend, grandmother, or any other special woman in your life worth carting up.

If they already have their go-to wardrobe essentials, look to upgraded versions of those ‚Äî think cashmere wraps, sunglasses clip ons, black diamond hoop earrings, and patterned pajama sets. For the homebody, consider a foot massager, red-light therapy panel, or luxe laundry detergent set. And we didn‚Äôt forget about the foodies and dinner party hosts, making sure to include cookbooks, bread ovens, non-alcoholic drink sets, and artisanal olive oil. So no matter your giftee‚Äôs style or interests, there‚Äôs a range of thoughtful beauty, lifestyle, entertainment, wellness, and fashion presents ready to be carted up for them.¬†¬†

Ahead, find 26 foolproof gifts for the woman who claims to want nothing this year that they'll appreciate, even if they didn't add them to their wishlist.

All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.
